title: Sexologist Chantelle Otten posts a heartfelt tribute to paralympian boyfriend Dylan Alcott
text:
She put on a glamorous display alongside her Paralympian boyfriend Dylan Alcott at the Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala dinner.

And on Friday, Chantelle Otten shared a heartfelt tribute to her beau for his efforts on the court.

The sexologist, whose practice is based in Melbourne, took to Instagram to share a photo of them looking very stylish on the red carpet.

'Couldn't be more proud to stand next to my champion': Sexologist Chantelle Otten has shared a heartfelt tribute to her Paralympian boyfriend Dylan Alcott after they stepped out for the Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala dinner on Friday

In the caption she wrote: 'Couldn’t be more proud to stand next to my champion @dylanalcott at The Australia Sport Hall of Fame awards last night.

'You are incredible in every way, the hardest worker, the best person, my daily inspiration and I love you more than life itself.'

She also went on to praise women's tennis champion Ash Barty for winning The Don award at the annual dinner, calling her 'amazing'.

Loved up: The sexologist continued in the caption, 'You are incredible in every way, the hardest worker, the best person, my daily inspiration and I love you more than life itself'

The couple, who debuted their romance on social media in April, enjoyed the attention on the red carpet of the sports gala.

Chantelle wowed in a figure-hugging white dress with a daring thigh split and cut-out detail at the waist.

Dylan cut a suave figure in a black and blue dinner suit, paired with a crisp white shirt and black bow tie.

The athlete recently told the Australian Women's Weekly that he rarely wakes up without a smile after finding love with Chantelle.

Happy in love: 'I have a beautiful family and a beautiful partner': The athlete recently said he is 'loving life'and he rarely wakes up without a smile after finding love with Chantelle

'I love life. I have a beautiful family and a beautiful partner and it's very rare that I don't wake up happy,' he told the magazine.

Dylan, whose ABC music show The Set won a Logie Award this year, also praised Chantelle for the support she has shown him over the past few months.

'I couldn't have done any of this without mum, dad and [my brother] Zack, and now Chantelle, around me to support and encourage me,' he said.

'People might look at me and feel sorry for me, but don't feel sorry for me! I'm living a better life than anyone I know. Life is awesome,' he added.
description: She put on a glamorous display alongside her Paralympian boyfriend Dylan Alcott at the Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala dinner.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
